text: Robert Louis "Bobby" Freeman (April 27, 1934 - May 16, 2016) was an American attorney and politician. He was born in Plaquemine, Louisiana. He was the Democratic lieutenant governor of the U.S. state of Louisiana from 1980 to 1988. He worked with governor Edwin Edwards. Before becoming a politician, Freeman was an amateur boxer. Freeman died at a hospital in Baton Rouge, Louisiana from an aneurysm on May 16, 2016, aged 82. ==References== Category:1934 births Category:2016 deaths Category:Lawyers from Louisiana Category:American boxers Category:Deaths from aneurysm Category:Disease- related deaths in Louisiana Category:Sportspeople from Louisiana Category:Democratic Party (United States) politicians Category:Lieutenant Governors of Louisiana
title: Robert Louis Freeman Sr.
